column4: any know off hand what the diffrence beteween debin debs and *buntu debs are?
no, it's a common sense issue; you don't install packages on one system that are designed for another system
ubuntu is is a debian distro unless something major changed sence the last time i looked, and im not tring to install on, just tring to reember what thediffrence is.
it's the same thing as that you don't install, say, RHEL RPMs on Fedora or Mandriva, despite the latter two being spin-offs of Red Hat
